entries.title: Data breaches could be even more expensive in 2023
entries.description: As the number of threats rise, the average cost of a breach could top $5 million.

entries.title: Thousands of Citrix servers could be at risk of attack
entries.description: Many servers remain unpatched and thus vulnerable to high-severity flaws.

entries.title: Google AdWords is being hijacked by scammers
entries.description: Seemingly benign campaigns promoting popular programs are actually delivering malware.

entries.title: Windows 11 could bring a divisive new feature to Notepad
entries.description: It looks like tabs might be coming to the simple text editor, or at least they’re in testing for the app.

entries.title: The latest Samsung Galaxy S23 leak points to a major performance boost
entries.description: We've got CPU, graphics, and neural processing boosts incoming thanks to the latest chipset from Qualcomm.

entries.title: Wrapping up the Mac for 2022: Ventura and M2 shone, but where's the Mac Pro?
entries.description: Apple enjoyed continued success with Apple silicon and macOS, and it looks as though it's finally taking gaming seriously.

entries.title: Code-generating tools could be more of a security hindrance than help
entries.description: Without the correct attention, code-generating tools like Copilot could present more security risks than before.

entries.title: Google Chrome is making a crucial update  to help keep you safe
entries.description: Chrome set to warn users against insecure HTTP downloads, on top of existing “Not Secure” address bar warnings.
